Port Scanner/ Port Scan Reconnaissance:

A port scanner is a tool used to scan and detect the availability of network ports on a given system, such as a computer or network device. Port scans are commonly used to identify networks that are vulnerable to outside unauthorized access. Port scanners are particularly useful in pentesting (penetration testing) situations, as they help to identify the number of available ports on a machine or network.

In a port scan, an attacker sends out a series of commands to the target system in the hopes of triggering port-scanning results. Port scans can reveal various types of information about a system, including its capabilities
